Python interpreter autocomplete + history with ~/.pythonrc

Jan 20, 2016

Using great tools is important, using autocompletion with great tools is even better!

Ever used python interpreter?

You should, install python if it’s not already the case and run python in your terminal. Awesome, an interpreter!

Get interpreter autocompletion

Here is what you’re looking for, create this file:

~/.pythonrc

Then, you need to tell python interpreter to use this ~/.pythonrc file, so add the following line somewhere in an rc file (either ~/.bashrc if you’re using bash or ~/.zshrc for the awesome oh-my-zsh)

You can also run this directly in your shell if you want to test before editing your rc` file.

That’s it, fire up a terminal, run python again and enjoy autocompletion with when you hit tab key :D

All of your tests in a local interpreter are now recoreded to ~/.pyhistory which could be useful and tab auto completion is just so usefull when experimenting with modules from the interwebs :)
